Description: Lower body sherd of Chian, probably Mature Animal Style, pottery chalice with top of foot; white slip; interior glazed streaky black with two added white bands around rosette of added red and white petals; exterior: reserved with two bands; outside of foot glazed; inscription on interior.
Curator's comments: The number 46 is written in pencil on the exterior surface of the sherd.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0535) (phase 2)
